org.magnos.net
Interface Adapter

All Known Subinterfaces:
Client, Server
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractClient, AbstractServer, TcpClient, TcpClient, TcpServer, TcpServer, UdpClient, UdpServer, UdpServerClient
public interface Adapter

An adapter is anything which can read, write, accept, or connect. This is used by workers and acceptors to process clients and servers.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Summary
 void handleAccept()
          Notifies the server/client it can now accept clients on its socket.
 void handleConnect()
          Notifies the server/client it can now complete its pending connection.
 void handleRead()
          Notifies the server/client that it can now read from its socket.
 void handleWrite()
          Notifies the server/client that it can now write to its socket.
 

Method Detail

handleRead

void handleRead()
Notifies the server/client that it can now read from its socket. This should not be invoked outside of the server/clients worker/acceptor.

handleWrite

void handleWrite()
Notifies the server/client that it can now write to its socket. This should not be invoked outside of the server/clients worker/acceptor.

handleAccept

void handleAccept()
Notifies the server/client it can now accept clients on its socket. This should not be invoked outside of the server/clients worker/acceptor.

handleConnect

void handleConnect()
Notifies the server/client it can now complete its pending connection. This should not be invoked outside of the server/clients worker/acceptor.
